ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:
Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

narratives.question_text:
What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I learned about the diversity that exists in many different branches of the tree of life, and methods used to study and draw inferences about them.

I gained some understanding of each of the major groups of living organisms, in terms of physical morphology, lifecycle and nutrient-gathering strategies, as well as a brief glimpse into the techniques used by biologists to recognize, catalogue, and model the development of features both of individual species and entire clades.
This course allowed me to explore many different topics on plants and fish and insects!!!
Classification, taxonomic keys, feeding modes of invertebrates, invertebrate body plans, stream diversity, angiosperm and gymnosperm diversity, birds and mammals body plans, fish, bacteria, archaea
How to write lab reports
A ton about the evolutionary tree of life  plants, trees, invertebrates, vertebrates, etc
I gained an appreciation for the diversity of life.
A wonderful introduction to biodiversity and the different ways of studying it.
Learned about the evolution of different body plans and ecological diversity in general.
Learned about evolutionary bio and the diversity of plants, animals bacteria...

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: The in-person lab was very hands-on and interesting

This course can feel a bit like following a checklist, due to the rubric-centric grading and large number of specific questions which require answering. This class truly shone when this checklist mentality was dispesed with and larger, more open questions were discussed.
This class has so much interesting information!

Amazing class, amazing TAs and professor. 

Weaknesses: The lectures could be altered to be more than a summary of the reading. Virtually, it was difficult in the sense that some labs would be dependent on what in person students did making it hard to write the lab report and the grading was done super late.

Difficult to do virtually

Instructions for assignments were very clear
Best professor!!
The course was engaging and interesting. The only weakness was that the lab reports were long and tedious.

This course was so, so great. The teaching team was so nice and caring, way moreso than in any other lab I have taken at Yale. The course material was really interesting, and taught in an informative way.
Class was super fun. The only thing was that the lab reports were fairly long and tedious at some points.
It was very fun, and the outdoor labs were super engaging.

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: The virtual activities were very well put together for the most part, and they provided a good overview of the material covered in the course. The ability to collaborate with groups in breakout rooms allowed all the work to be done effectively and any questions to be answered. However, at times when the virtual activities were mismatched with the in-person content, it could be difficult to find resources to rectify the discrepancy and allow all requirements to be answered.
Nothing
Great covid set up

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: This was a fun course to take! I learned a lot more than I expected (especially since this was my first E&EB lab)

This course was in many ways similar to classes I took in high school, from the rubric-centric grading scheme to the relatively straightforward activities leading to larger analysis questions to the artistic component and its contribution to the overall grade. Any given student will likely have their own opinions about their high school experience, and whether they are interested in repeating it in a class at Yale.
Yes! Amazing course and amazing professors
Yes! Fantastic lab full of caring students, professors, and TAs
Yes. Very interesting content. Not too difficult
Yes best lab I have taken besides professor wells other lab
This is a great course even for those who don't have any background. That said, the workload is pretty heavy and consistent.
Absolutely, I have already recommended this course to a number of friends who are looking for bio labs.
Yes, it's a really fun and relaxed biology lab! Dr. Wells is super knowledgeable and passionate about evolutionary bio.
Yes! It's so engaging and low stress, which makes for a great learning environment

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.
comments: Live virtual lecture
It was a virtual lab combined with an in-person lab option
Live
